TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RequestContext extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Encapsulates information about an HTTP request that matches a defined route.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext> class contains information about the HTTP request in the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.HttpContext%2A> property. It contains information about the route that matched the current request in the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.RouteData%2A> property.
When you construct a URL from a route, you pass an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext> class to the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.GetVirtualPath%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.HttpContextBase httpContext, class System.Web.Routing.RouteData routeData) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains information about the HTTP request.
An object that contains information about the route that matched the current request.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.HttpContextBase HttpContext { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets information about the HTTP request.
Docs.value: An object that contains information about the HTTP request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To set the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.HttpContext%2A> property, you must pass the value as a parameter when you call the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.%23ctor%28System.Web.HttpContextBase%2CSystem.Web.Routing.RouteData%29> constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.Routing.RouteData RouteData { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets information about the requested route.
Docs.value: An object that contains information about the requested route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To set the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.RouteData%2A> property, you must pass the value as a parameter when you call the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RequestContext.%23ctor%28System.Web.HttpContextBase%2CSystem.Web.Routing.RouteData%29> constructor.
